entry.title: Everything is Blue (Grey)
entry.summary:
Author: AluminiumBottleOfWater

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 615Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 4

Summary: He looks over the city again, past the dark grey roof he's sitting on, past the dusty grey coating the car wheels on grey streets, a grey overcoat of an overworked man trudging to his empty house, the grey clouds rolling overhead, a flash of red at the corner of his eyes, a grey bird in a tall tree— He blinks, immediately on alert. *There's no red in Gotham—* "Bruce." ----- Basically, Bruce finds out that there are other colors beside grey and black.

entry.title: There's Something So Lonesome About You
entry.summary:
Author: hoeforhoran28

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 90,891Chapters: 21/21Kudos: 1,437

Summary: "Your identity was supposed to be a secret. Not only to protect yourself (and probably least importantly yourself) but others. Your family, your friends. Everyone who stood a chance at being ripped apart by your decision to go out there everyday and put yourself in the crossfire. Not that Bruce had anyone to protect, besides Alfred. But it was still a fucking given." Or: Bruce has been Batman for two years and if he knew anything, it was that when you don a mask, you don it for a reason. An important reason that just doesn't seem to be as important to the rest of the League as it is to him. This is going to be a story about Bruce being coaxed into allowing others behind his carefully built walls. (Specifically one person.)
